p: The analysis of variance (MANOVA at P < 0.05) revealed a significant effect of the Ruta chalepensis essential oil concentration and the duration of exposure tested on adults of Tribolium castaneum; the comparison of means was performed using the Tukey test at the 5% probability level, and it appears that the repellent activity of the essential oil was correlated with the concentrations and the duration of exposure ( Table 3).
